title: Ash Training Day 5 Part 1
description: Understanding trading bias, higher timeframe bias, and how to use bias for trading decisions.
content:
In this lesson, you'll learn:

• What bias means in trading context
• How to form directional bias
• Using daily bias for lower timeframe entries
• HTF bias overriding LTF noise
• The dangers of trading without bias
• How to align bias with structure and liquidity

quiz.question: Bias in trading means:
quiz.explanation: Bias is your directional expectation based on structural analysis, not emotions or guesses.

quiz.question: Daily bias helps:
quiz.explanation: Daily bias provides context and direction for making better entries on lower timeframes.

quiz.question: HTF bias overrides:
quiz.explanation: Higher timeframe bias should override lower timeframe noise to prevent trading against major trends.

quiz.question: A wrong bias leads to:
quiz.explanation: Incorrect bias causes traders to force entries and trade against the prevailing trend.

quiz.question: Bias should be based on:
quiz.explanation: Bias must be grounded in objective market structure and liquidity analysis, not subjective factors.
